skill.name: ghe-changelog
skill.description: This skill should be used when updating the project CHANGELOG, tracking requirement changes, recording design decisions, or documenting version history. Uses git-diff to detect and categorize changes to both code and requirements. Trigger on "changelog", "version history", "what changed", or after significant commits.
skill.summary: This skill should be used when updating the project CHANGELOG, tracking requirement changes, recordi...
skill.author: Emasoft

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and example bash scripts embedded as reference material. No executable files, network calls, or sensitive operations. The skill provides instructions for changelog management using git commands.

content.value_statement: Manually tracking project changes across releases is error-prone and time-consuming. This skill automates changelog generation by analyzing git commits, diffs, and file changes to categorize updates into features, fixes, requirements, and design decisions.
actual_capabilities: Detect and categorize changes using git-diff analysis
Document design decisions and architecture changes
Generate conventional commit summaries (feat:, fix:, chore:)
Integrate with GHE phase completion workflow
Prepare release changelog entries with version bumps
limitations: Does not execute git commands directly; relies on AI tool use
Requires conventional commit message format for best results
Does not auto-commit changelog changes to git
Cannot detect semantic version impact without manual review

use_cases.title: Prepare release notes
use_cases.description: Generate professional release notes from git history for software distributions

use_cases.title: Track all project changes
use_cases.description: Maintain comprehensive documentation of code, requirements, and design evolution

use_cases.title: Automate release workflow
use_cases.description: Integrate changelog generation into CI/CD pipelines for consistent versioning

prompt_templates.title: Quick changelog query
prompt_templates.prompt: What changed in the last release? Show me all new features, bug fixes, and requirements updates.

prompt_templates.title: Generate release notes
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a changelog for version X.Y.Z. Include all commits since the last tag, categorized by type.

prompt_templates.title: Track requirements
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me all requirements that changed since the last release. Include old and new version numbers.

prompt_templates.title: Full project audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Give me a complete summary of everything that changed: features, fixes, requirements, and design decisions since the initial commit.

output: - User authentication module with OAuth support
- Memory leak in data processing pipeline
- Switched from REST to GraphQL for API layer (ADR-015)

best_practices: Use conventional commit messages (feat:, fix:, chore:, docs:) for automatic categorization
Version requirements files (REQ-XXX) whenever changing specifications
Create Architecture Decision Records (ADRs) before major design changes
Review auto-generated changelog entries before releasing
anti_patterns: Skipping changelog review and releasing unverified entries
Using non-descriptive commit messages like 'fixed stuff' or 'updates'
Modifying released changelog entries instead of adding new version sections
Forgetting to track requirements or design changes separately

faq.question: What conventional commit formats are supported?
faq.answer: Supports feat:, fix:, chore:, docs:, refactor:, test:, style:, build:, perf:, ci: prefixes for automatic categorization.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with GitHub, GitLab, and Bitbucket?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill uses standard git commands that work with any git hosting platform including GitHub, GitLab, and Bitbucket.

faq.question: What changelog formats does this skill support?
faq.answer: Supports Keep a Changelog, Conventional Commits, and custom formats defined in .claude/ghe.local.md configuration.

faq.question: Is my changelog data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. All changelog generation happens locally using git commands. No data is transmitted to external services.

faq.question: Why are my commits not appearing in the changelog?
faq.answer: Ensure commits use conventional prefixes. Check that you are comparing from the correct git tag or commit range.

faq.question: How is this skill different from git-changelog tools?
faq.answer: This skill understands GHE workflow phases and integrates with requirements tracking and design decision documentation.
